text: Anyone else having issues with the ssl verification email being sent. HubSpot can't confirm or deny it was sent...

On a website. Basically, our current design is each podcast episode on a listing page is in a card/grid format. Our PM really doens't like the media players that basically all the hosting platforms have (where each epsiode is just a row)
he wants to keep the grid format but none of the embedded players seem to have that

Yeah, I'm personally pushing for Simplecast but we'll see. But yeah Jon, basically what you said. Can't seem to find anything around what we're envisioning though

HS Employees, is there a new page editor beta going on? I have a client that doesn’t seem super excited by it.

I told her to contact HS support if she feels she can’t adapt to the changes or if she finds bugs.

Not sure what your exact needs are, but maybe take a look at <https://transistor.fm/>

Here's an example of the website hosted with them: <https://www.thegoodnewspodcast.fm/>
so i tried to export the history of a contact property and have been waiting about ~30mins~ 1 hr now for it to send over/show, is that normal?
Yeah, looked at Transistor too. Thanks!
We have the <#CDU990ECW|drag-n-drop-pages> going on - is this what she might be referencing?
Good luck! Would be interested in knowing your final pick and why (just for my own reference in the future)
no, it’s to do with the rich text editors. The UI  is changed around(it doesn’t look like a bug, looks like a test of a new design)

that was clients response to me after my explaining
basically her issue was, it was a sudden and big change that she wasn’t notified of, she doesn’t like the source button being hidden.
Sure, will do

Hi Remington,

My name is Cameron, it’s nice to meet you!

I just took a look at the ticket/situation with your domain, I do see that the domain’s validation method was changed in our system, meaning that when you clicked the link within the domain manager, our system would have sent the domain validation email; however with the introduction of GDPR a lot of DNS providers hide/redact domain ownership information from public record occasionally causing these emails to not send to the proper place.

We have an alternate method of domain validation, whereby HubSpot can supply you with a CNAME record to create on a separate host (not the ‘www’ host). The host is very unique, meaning it wouldn’t interfere with any current DNS records you have, and proves domain ownership allowing us to issue an SSL certificate for the ‘www’ subdomain you are looking to connect.

While I can definitely provide you with such a record for this alternate method, I would want to point out that this process shouldn’t be necessary in your case.

These methods of domain validation, prior to connection of the subdomain, are done so that an SSL certificate can be generated before a connection is made, so that if visitors are currently accessing your site over ‘https’ and you switch web hosts, that they continue to access the site over ‘https’ without issue.

I can see that there is no certificate covering the subdomain on your external web host, meaning that ‘SSL downtime’ would not be a concern, and that you could move forward with the connection process (creating the appropriate CNAME records) without issue.

Shortly after connection, an SSL certificate will be auto generated for the subdomain.
From what the IT contact at the company is stating there is SSL at the root level of the domain. The alternative verification information would be graet. I'll DM you
